Major_Arcs.title: Arrival and Initial Reactions to Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of Ghost Town, the initial mystery surrounding its authenticity, and the contrasting reactions of different characters to this unusual place.

sub_scenes.title: Discovery of the Saloon
sub_scenes.description: A woman in a green hat enters a bustling saloon in Ghost Town and is immediately struck by its seemingly authentic historical atmosphere, sparking her initial reaction and sense of mystery.

narrative_arcs.title: Woman's Internal Thoughts on Time Discrepancy

sub_scenes.title: Conversation about Leaving
sub_scenes.description: A man in a blue hat attempts to persuade a blonde woman to leave Ghost Town, hinting at repeated dangers and a sense of urgency tied to the place, contrasting with the woman in green hat's fascination.

Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town's Past and Present: Memory vs. Reality
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores Nan's personal history with Ghost Town, contrasting her nostalgic memories with the harsh reality of its planned demolition and the external forces of progress.

sub_scenes.title: Nostalgic Reminiscence
sub_scenes.description: Nan reflects on her deep emotional connection to Ghost Town from her childhood, viewing it as the embodiment of the Old West and a place of personal significance and escape.

sub_scenes.title: Clarification and Impending Demolition
sub_scenes.description: The current status of Ghost Town is clarified as Merrick Gulch, soon to be destroyed for an airport. This revelation shatters Nan's nostalgic view and introduces the central conflict of preservation versus progress.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification of Ghost Town's Current State
Reaction to Airport Plan - Initial Shock and Disbelief

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Dynamics and the Impending Demolition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the complex relationship between Nan and Cal, set against the backdrop of Ghost Town's demolition. It explores their contrasting perspectives on romance, reality, and their shared history.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Notions vs. Practical Love
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal discuss their relationship, highlighting Nan's romantic ideals and Cal's more practical expressions of love, revealing a long-standing tension between their expectations.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Perspective on Dreams and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Desert Observation and Demolition
sub_scenes.description: A brief observation of the desert transitions into the chaotic scene of Ghost Town's demolition, where Nan and Cal witness the destruction and escalating conflict.

Major_Arcs.title: Business, Paternal Authority, and Emotional Turmoil
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to domestic and familial conflict, exploring Nan's strained relationship with her father, her feelings of humiliation and betrayal, and the traditional views on gender roles and relationships.

sub_scenes.title: Business Logistics and Horse Rental
sub_scenes.description: Business discussions about shipping and horse rental for the airport construction take place, highlighting the practicalities clashing with Nan's emotional distress.

sub_scenes.title: Paternal Dismissal and Threat
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts her father about feeling dismissed, leading to a stern paternal rebuke and threat, showcasing the patriarchal power dynamics.

sub_scenes.title: Humiliation and Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: Nan's emotional fallout from the confrontation with her father, including feelings of humiliation and betrayal, and a maid's attempt at stoic comfort, emphasizes her isolation and emotional pain.

Major_Arcs.title: Reassurance and Resolve in Love
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's emotional recovery and determination in her relationship with Cal, guided by maternal and maidly advice, and culminating in her resolve to seek clarity.

sub_scenes.title: Maternal Comfort and Advice
sub_scenes.description: Nan's mother comforts her, offering relationship advice centered around patience and believing in Cal's love, providing a traditional perspective on romance.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation of Cal's Affection and Effort

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Determination for Clarity
sub_scenes.description: Despite reassurances, Nan decides to take action to understand her relationship with Cal, resolving to seek clarity and confront him directly.

sub_scenes.title: Business Interruption and Deal Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Business urgency related to horses for the airport intrudes upon Nan's personal resolve, leading to a brief business confrontation before she pursues her personal quest.

Major_Arcs.title: Pursuit and Confrontation: Seeking Clarity in Love
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Nan's pursuit of Cal and their direct confrontation, where she expresses her deepest feelings, faces his cryptic responses, and experiences a period of longing and emotional intensity during his absence.

sub_scenes.title: Expression of Deep Feelings and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her profound feelings to Cal, but his cryptic response and abrupt departure leave her questioning the depth of his emotions and intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Deep Feelings and Cryptic Response
Passage of Time and Lingering Longing
Confession of Pursuit and Revealed Motivation

sub_scenes.title: Snowy Confrontation and Weather Report
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal about his changed behavior in a snowy setting, but their intimate conversation is interrupted by the arrival of Mr. Wills with a grim weather report, foreshadowing external challenges.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Confession about Changed Behavior

Major_Arcs.title: Blizzard and Operation Hay Lift: Crisis and Hope
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the unfolding blizzard, the dire situation it creates for livestock, and the arrival of 'Operation Hay Lift' as a beacon of hope, resolving the immediate crisis and bringing emotional relief.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Deterioration and Livestock Concern
sub_scenes.description: The focus shifts to the worsening blizzard and the growing concern about livestock fodder, highlighting the practical dangers posed by the severe weather.

narrative_arcs.title: Indoor Discussion of Weather and Worry for Loved Ones
Cal's Determined Resolve and Acceptance of Responsibility

sub_scenes.title: Despair and Arrival of Hope
sub_scenes.description: Indoor concerns and expressions of hopelessness contrast with the hopeful arrival of 'Operation Hay Lift', providing a turning point from despair to relief and gratitude.

narrative_arcs.title: Recollection of Restlessness and Expression of Hopelessness
Arrival of the Plane and Fodder Drop
Relief, Gratitude, and Renewed Hope with 'Operation Hay Lift'

Major_Arcs.title: Western Showdown and Differing Perspectives on Heroism
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a classic Western town setting and a cowboy showdown, exploring varied perspectives on heroism, manners, and the nature of action versus words.

sub_scenes.title: Town Square Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: A dramatic cowboy showdown in a Western town square draws varied reactions from onlookers, setting the stage for differing interpretations of the cowboy's actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense and Critique of Cowboy's Manners

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Hero Worship and Sibling Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on Sally's concern for her brother Jeff's hero worship of Clyde Surrett, leading to sibling conflict and contrasting views on guns, manners, and role models.

sub_scenes.title: Worry over Jeff's Fixation
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Pete discuss Jeff's unhealthy hero worship and fascination with guns, highlighting Sally's deep concern for her brother's path.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Concern for Jeff's Hero Worship
Sally's Disappointment and Jeff's Clyde Surrett Defense
Jeff's Justification of Clyde Surrett and Dismissal of Chane Benson
Sally's Rejection of Jeff's Claims and Warning
Jeff's Threat and Sally's Fearful Response

Major_Arcs.title: Intervention and Shifting Perspectives on Jeff
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Sally's attempts to intervene in Jeff's behavior, seeking help from Clyde and Pete, and introducing Mr. Benson as a figure of advice and contrast to Clyde's influence.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Frustration and Plea to Clyde
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses her deep frustration and worry about Jeff to Clyde, seeking his help and highlighting her unsuccessful attempts to control his behavior.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Plea to Clyde and His Reassurance
Pete's Commitment to Helping Jeff and Sally's Appreciation
Pete's Flashback and Gun Advice to Young Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and His Humble Response

Major_Arcs.title: Article Controversy and Benson-Clyde Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc revolves around the controversy caused by Clyde's article, the escalating tension between Clyde and Benson, and Sally's warnings and attempts to mediate the conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Public Outrage and Sally's Warning
sub_scenes.description: Public outrage erupts over Clyde's article, and Sally warns Mr. Benson about the potential danger from Clyde's anger.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Warning to Mr. Benson about Clyde's Anger
Mr. Benson's Dismissal of Danger and Confrontation with Sally
Mr. Benson's Justification for Staying in Town

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Clyde's Defiance
sub_scenes.description: Clyde faces immediate backlash and threats due to his article, but remains defiant and committed to his journalistic principles, setting up a clash of ideologies.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Defense Regarding Clyde's Article
Background on Clyde's Defiant Actions and Consequences
Sally and Jeff's Discussion about Clyde and Benson's Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Skill Assessment
sub_scenes.description: A dinner invitation for Chane Benson is proposed, and Jeff evaluates Chane's skills, hinting at underlying motives and strategic social interactions.

narrative_arcs.title: Dinner Invitation and Evaluation of Chane's Skills

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner, Accusations, and Physical Conflict between Siblings
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the dinner with Chane, followed by escalating sibling conflict between Jeff and Sally, involving accusations, physical struggle, and emotional betrayal.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner and Moonlight Observation
sub_scenes.description: The dinner with Chane Benson proceeds, with Chane subtly aware of hidden motives, followed by a polite exchange between Sally and Chane under the moonlight, masking underlying tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Sibling Confrontation and Physical Aggression
sub_scenes.description: Jeff confronts Sally with accusations of betrayal and sympathy for Clyde, escalating into a physical struggle and a forced kiss, revealing deep-seated sibling conflict and emotional violation.

Major_Arcs.title: Intervention, Assault, and Pursuit of Clyde
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Chane's intervention in the sibling conflict, Benson's violent assault on Jeff, and the escalating action as Chane pursues Clyde, prompting urgent reactions from Sally and Jeff.

sub_scenes.title: Chane's Intervention and Benson's Assault
sub_scenes.description: Chane interrupts the confrontation, expressing disappointment in Jeff's behavior, immediately followed by Benson's sudden and forceful assault on Jeff, escalating the physical violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Urgency and Chane's Pursuit of Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Determined Pursuit and Town Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Jeff, driven by urgency and determination, rides swiftly to town to intervene in Chane's pursuit of Clyde, leading to a tense confrontation with Benson in town.

Major_Arcs.title: Standoff, Resolution, and Journalistic Aftermath
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the tense standoff between Benson and Jeff, the resolution of the conflict with Benson leaving town, and the journalistic reflection on courage and decency in the aftermath.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Threats and Tense Wait
sub_scenes.description: Benson's escalating threats towards Jeff create a tense standoff, followed by an anxious wait in the Clarion office, heightening suspense.

narrative_arcs.title: Anticipation and Fear at the Door

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Management and New Boss Dynamics
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new setting at a ranch, introducing Betsy as the ranch manager and Steve Daley as the new boss, exploring themes of ranch policy, authority, and emerging romantic tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Brawl and Introduction of New Boss
sub_scenes.description: A ranch brawl establishes a firm stance against gun violence, followed by the introduction of Steve Daley as the new boss and Betsy's role as manager, setting up new power dynamics.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Brawl and Rejection of Gunplay
Introducing Steve Daley and the New Boss
Confirmation of Betsy's Competence and Steve's Approval

sub_scenes.title: Testing Boundaries and Ranch Troubles
sub_scenes.description: Betsy tests Steve's reaction with strong language, revealing his unflappable nature, followed by Hank's skepticism and Betsy's defense of Steve, and the revelation of serious ranch troubles.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Casual Acceptance and Betsy's Amusement
Hank's Skepticism and Betsy's Defense of Steve
Betsy's Accusation and Hank's Explanation of Ranch Troubles
Mutual Caution and Agreement to Investigate
Departure to Town and Buckboard Ride
Questioning Hank's Orders and Material for Dress

Major_Arcs.title: Town Confrontation and Romantic Revelation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Betsy and Steve's arrival in town leading to a violent confrontation with Fred Bridges' men, followed by a romantic revelation and proposal amidst the escalating ranch troubles.

sub_scenes.title: Town Arrival and Violent Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve arrive in town and are immediately confronted by Fred Bridges and his men, leading to a physical fight and highlighting Steve's fighting skills.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Policy and Romantic Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Betsy reiterates her ranch policy against gunmen, leading to Steve's gunslinger proposition and a romantic revelation culminating in a marriage proposal and acceptance.

sub_scenes.title: Gun Policy and Love's Proof
sub_scenes.description: Betsy insists on her anti-gun policy and demands proof of Steve's love, leading to a passionate declaration from Steve and his willingness to give up his gun for her.

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass: Past Betrayal and Present Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to Devil's Pass, revisiting Steve's past betrayal and setting the stage for a violent confrontation, culminating in Betsy's injury and a tense standoff.

sub_scenes.title: Bridges' Complaint and Pursuit to Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges complains to Betsy, leading to his men's threats and Betsy's warning to Steve about the dangerous valley route, setting up the journey to Devil's Pass.

narrative_arcs.title: Valley Route Warning and Impending Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Departure and Devil's Pass Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Betsy's emotional pleas fail to dissuade Steve from his course of action, leading to his determined departure and arrival at Devil's Pass, setting the stage for confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Resolution at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Despite the violence and injury, Betsy and Steve find romantic resolution and reaffirm their love amidst the chaos of Devil's Pass, concluding their immediate conflict with emotional reconciliation.

Major_Arcs.title: New Romantic Entanglements and Ranch Rivalry
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new romantic entanglement with Carrie, Dave, and Fred, set against the backdrop of ranch rivalries and land disputes, creating a new set of interpersonal and external conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Worry for Dave and Ranch Concerns
sub_scenes.description: A woman expresses concern for Dave's emotional state and her father's potential disapproval, transitioning to ranch concerns about Curley and the Bear Fenin gang, introducing new characters and conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dave and Father's Disapproval
Reflection on Morning Routine and Curley's Presence
Concern about Curley and Bear Fenin's Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Land Dispute and Escalating Tension
sub_scenes.description: A land dispute over fencing escalates with the arrival of Fred Gordon and his group, leading to a tense confrontation and the threat of violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Dispute Over Fencing and Grazing Land
Escalating Tension Over Fence and Water Access
Defensive Stance and Threat of Gunplay
Curley's Gun Draw and Impending Violence

Major_Arcs.title: Reconciliation, Conflicted Feelings, and Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores Curley's apology and remorse, Carrie's conflicted feelings between Dave and Fred, and ultimately, Fred's manipulative nature leading to Carrie's rejection and confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Curley's Apology and Remorse
sub_scenes.description: Curley apologizes to Carrie, expressing regret for his past actions and revealing his motivations for his behavior.

sub_scenes.title: Conflicted Feelings and Romantic Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave discuss their relationship and her feelings for Fred, leading to Carrie and Fred reconciling and a marriage proposal based on Carrie's changing feelings.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave Discussing Feelings and Fred

sub_scenes.title: Contract Justification and Rejection of Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: Fred's manipulative justification of the Carlton Contract reveals his true motives, leading to Carrie's angry rejection and confrontation, exposing his deceit.

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation, Emotional Release, and Victory
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie's confrontation of Fred at Carlton's office, leading to her emotional release and ultimate victory over Fred's schemes, concluding their immediate conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Office Confrontation and Assertion of Independence
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Fred and Carlton at Carlton's office, accusing Fred of deception and asserting her independence and resolve to manage her own ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office
Reflecting on Fred's Defeat and Carrie's Victory

Major_Arcs.title: Reunion, Confession, and Lingering Suspicions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie and Dave's reunion, Carrie's confession of love for Fred, and Dave's lingering suspicion about Carrie's interaction with Fred, creating a bittersweet tone.

sub_scenes.title: Chance Encounter and Love Confession
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave's chance encounter at a store leads to Carrie confessing her love for Fred, resolving her immediate romantic conflict but introducing new complexities.

narrative_arcs.title: Chance Encounter and Casual Conversation at the Store
Inquiries About Fred and Confession of Love

Major_Arcs.title: Illness, Confrontation, and Final Romantic Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie's illness, a confrontation with Fred led by her father, and ultimately, a romantic resolution between Carrie and Fred, concluding their complex relationship arc.

sub_scenes.title: Illness and Unexpected Visitors
sub_scenes.description: Carrie's illness brings unexpected visitors, including Fred and Carlton, setting the stage for a confrontation and a resolution to her romantic entanglements.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Concern and Arrival of Visitors

Major_Arcs.title: Brother's Injury and Escape Plan
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new storyline centered around Chris and her injured brother Dirk, focusing on the urgency of his situation, the discovery of his gunshot wound, and the planning of an escape.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Arrival and Shocking Injury Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's urgent arrival and Chris's discovery of his gunshot wound initiate a new crisis and set the stage for immediate action and worry.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Escape Formulation
sub_scenes.description: The father initiates an investigation, while Chris formulates an escape plan for Dirk, setting in motion a sequence of urgent actions and decisions.

narrative_arcs.title: Escalating Confrontation and Claim of Authority
Passage of Time and Acceptance of Reality
Re-emergence of Duty and Dirk's Fate

Major_Arcs.title: The Chase, Shootout, and Moral Dilemma
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the dramatic chase and shootout, culminating in Rance's injury and a moral dilemma regarding his fate, pushing the characters to make life-altering decisions under pressure.

sub_scenes.title: The Chase and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: The escape attempt turns into a desperate chase, culminating in a violent shootout and Rance Cready's injury, escalating the immediate danger and moral stakes.

narrative_arcs.title: Moral Dilemma: Mercy Killing vs. Survival

Major_Arcs.title: First Aid, Confessions, and Escape to Mexico
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the immediate aftermath of the shootout, including first aid for Rance, emotional confessions between the characters, Dirk's escape to Mexico, and a sense of relief and resolution.

sub_scenes.title: First Aid and Rance's Confession
sub_scenes.description: Chris provides first aid to Rance, while Rance reflects internally and confesses his realization about Chris's feelings and his own vulnerability.

narrative_arcs.title: Providing First Aid and Assessing Injury
Parting Ways and Concern for Criminal Escape
Plea to Return and Confession of Love
Rance's Self-Recrimination and Awareness of Burden
Concern for Riding and Inquiry about Dirk
Successful Escape to Mexico and Relief

Major_Arcs.title: Recovery, Love Confession, and Wedding Preparations
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Rance's recovery, culminates in Chris and Rance's mutual love confessions and engagement, and transitions to the wedding day preparations, bringing the narrative towards a romantic conclusion.

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Initial Care
sub_scenes.description: Rance awakens to find himself being cared for by Chris and his father, marking the beginning of his recovery and setting a tender tone.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance's Reassurance and Readiness for Action
